holidays.name: Water A Flower Day
holidays.description: A charming day dedicated to showing your flowers some love and hydration. Perfect for gardeners and plant lovers to nurture their blooms and enjoy a splash of nature's beauty.
holidays.origin: The origins are unclear, but this day has been embraced by gardening communities to remind people to care for their plants as the weather warms up.
holidays.funFact: Did you know that watering plants early in the morning helps reduce evaporation and keeps flowers hydrated longer?

holidays.name: National Creativity Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and unleash your creative side, whether through art, writing, music, or any quirky craft. It's all about thinking outside the box and having fun with imagination!
holidays.origin: National Creativity Day was established by Adobe Systems to encourage people to discover and expand their creative potential.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that engaging in creative activities can boost happiness and reduce stress levels.

holidays.name: Amnesty International Day
holidays.description: Commemorating the founding of Amnesty International, this day raises awareness about human rights and the fight against injustice worldwide.
holidays.origin: Founded on May 30, 1961, Amnesty International has become a global movement campaigning for human rights.
holidays.funFact: Amnesty International won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1977 for its courageous work defending human rights.

holidays.name: Memorial Day (Observed on May 30 in some years)
holidays.description: A day of remembrance for those who've died in military service, often marked by ceremonies, parades, and honoring fallen heroes at national cemeteries.
holidays.origin: Originally known as Decoration Day post-Civil War, it became the U.S. federal holiday to honor military personnel who died in service.
holidays.funFact: Many people consider Memorial Day the unofficial start of summer in the U.S., complete with barbecues and outdoor activities.

holidays.name: Slap Your Technician Day
holidays.description: A humorous and satirical unofficial holiday poking fun at the frustrations some people feel when dealing with tech support—though of course no actual slapping!
holidays.origin: It emerged online as a funny way to vent about technology troubles and the sometimes mystifying world of tech support.
holidays.funFact: Despite the name, this day reminds us to appreciate tech support workers who often save us from computer chaos!
